BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: GOODWILL INDUSTRIES OF SW FLORIDA INC

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: GOODWILL INDUSTRIES OF SOUTHWEST FLORIDA IS COMMITTED TO SERVING PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND DISADVANTAGES BY OFFERING LIFE-CHANGING OPPORTUNITIES TO ACHIEVE INDEPENDENCE.
IRS990.MissionDesc: GOODWILL INDUSTRIES OF SOUTHWEST FLORIDA IS COMMITTED TO SERVING PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND DISADVANTAGES BY OFFERING LIFE-CHANGING OPPORTUNITIES TO ACHIEVE INDEPENDENCE.
IRS990.Desc: RETAIL STORE OPERATIONS: GOODWILL OPERATES THRIFT STORES IN THE LOCAL FIVE COUNTY AREA WHICH SELL DONATED AND PURCHASED GOODS. THESE STORES PROVIDE JOBS AND TRAINING AS WELL AS ASSISTANCE AND AFFORDABLE GOODS TO THE LOCAL AREA'S FAMILIES AND CHILDREN. IN ADDITION TO THE $520,259 NET INCOME RESULTING FROM THE SALE OF PURCHASED GOODS AS REFLECTED ON FORM 990, PAGE 9, PART VIII, LINE 10, THE ORGANIZATION RECEIVED $23,279,464 OF DONATED GOODS RELATED TO THIS PROGRAM DURING THE YEAR WHICH ARE REFLECTED WITHIN NONCASH CONTRIBUTIONS ON FORM 990, PAGE 9, PART VIII, LINE 1G.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: E-COMMERCE: GOODWILL OPERATES AN E-COMMERCE SELLING PROGRAM WHICH LISTS USED GOODS, BOOKS AND COMPUTERS AS WELL AS HIGH END DONATED GOODS FOR SALE. THIS OPERATION PROVIDES JOB OPPORTUNITIES FOR DISADVANTAGED CITIZENS WITHIN OUR COMMUNITY. IN ADDITION TO THE $1,202,456 OF DELIVERY INCOME GENERATED THROUGH THE PROGRAM, THE ORGANIZATION RECEIVED $1,833,909 OF DONATED GOODS RELATED TO THIS PROGRAM DURING THE YEAR WHICH ARE REFLECTED WITHIN NONCASH CONTRIBUTIONS ON FORM 990, PAGE 9, PART VIII, LINE 1G.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: SALVAGE AND RECYLCING: GOODWILL OPERATES A SALVAGE AND RECYCLING PROGRAM WHICH PROVIDES JOBS AND JOB TRAINING AS WELL AS A MEANS OF SALVAGING AND SHIPPING CLOTHING TO THOSE IN NEED IN OTHER COUNTRIES. THE ORGANIZATION RECEIVED $1,215,213 OF DONATED GOODS RELATED TO THIS PROGRAM DURING THE YEAR WHICH ARE REFLECTED WITHIN NONCASH CONTRIBUTIONS ON FORM 990, PAGE 9, PART VIII, LINE 1G.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: CONTRACT INCOME: GOODWILL OPERATES A MICRO-ENTERPRISE PROGRAM TO PROVIDE ASPIRING SMALL BUSINESS OWNERS WITH THE SKILLS THEY NEED TO SUCCEED AS ENTREPRENEURS & BECOME MORE INDEPENDENT. GOODWILL'S JOBLINK CENTERS HELP PEOPLE WITH EMPLOYMENT, SKILLS TRAINING AND FAMILY STRENGTHENING TRAINING. THE ORGANIZATION ALSO PROVIDES EMPLOYMENT AND EMPLOYMENT SERVICES TO ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES WHO ARE SEEKING OPPORTUNITIES TO OBTAIN INDEPENDENCE.
OTHER SERVICES CONSISTS PRIMARILY OF SERVICES PROVIDED TO DISABLED OR DISADVANTAGED CITIZENS WITHIN THE COMMUNITY IN AREAS OF FAMILY SERVICES AND AT RISK YOUTH TRAINING.
RENTAL PROPERTIES: GOODWILL OPERATES VARIOUS RENTAL PROPERTIES AS A BASIS OF DEFERRING COSTS OF FACILITIES SLATED FOR FUTURE EXPANSION.

ContractorCompensationGrp.ServicesDesc: TEMPORARY STAFFING, DIRECT HIRE AND OTHE

OtherAssetsOrgGrp.Desc: PROPERTY, PLANT, AND EQUIPMENT HELD FOR SALE
DUE FROM HUD SPONSORED LONG TERM

OtherLiabilitiesOrgGrp.Desc: FAIR MARKET VALUE OF INTEREST RATE SWAP AGREEMENT

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GOODWILL IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE, AND HAS BEEN DETERMINED NOT TO BE A PRIVATE FOUNDATION (WITHIN THE MEANING OF SECTION 509(A) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. THE ORGANIZATION FOLLOWS THE INCOME TAX STANDARD FOR UNCERTAIN POSITIONS. THE STANDARD HAD NO EFFECT ON THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. MANAGEMENT HAS DETERMINED THAT GOODWILL HAS NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS AS OF DECEMBER 31, 2015 AND 2014.
FUNDRAISING EVENT COSTS -5,623. COST OF GOODS SOLD INVENTORY -875,184.

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: TO SUPPORT HOME DEPOT GRANT PROGRAMS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ROTARY DUES ARE PAID ON BEHALF OF RICK EVANCHYK IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,150. THE DUES ARE NOT INCLUDED IN HIS TAXABLE COMPENSATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 1
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD IS AUTHORIZED TO ACT ON BEHALF AND INSTEAD OF THE BOARD IN ALL MATTERS RELATING TO THE OPERATION OF THE ORGANIZATION EXCEPT THEY ARE NOT AUTHORIZED TO APPROVE PURCHASES OR SALES OF PROPERTY. EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MINUTES ARE RATIFIED AT EACH SUCESSIVE BOARD MEETING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ONCE THE FORM IS PREPARED, THE VICE PRESIDENT OF FINANCE REVIEWS THE INFORMATION ON THE RETURN. THE FORM IS THEN BROUGHT TO THE PRESIDENT/CEO FOR THEIR FINAL REVIEW BEFORE THE 990 IS FILED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: INTERESTED PERSONS ARE REQUIRED TO DISCLOSE KNOWN CONFLICTS OF INTERESTS ANNUALLY AND IF ANY POTENTIAL ISSUES ARISE DURING BOARD MEETING. ANY PROPOSED CONTRACT EXCEEDING $500 THAT HAS A POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST IS VOTED ON BY THE BOARD AND THE INTERESTED PERSON IS NOT ALLOWED TO VOTE ON THE ISSUE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CEO COMPENSATION IS REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD ON AN ANNUAL BASIS AFTER ACTION IS TAKEN BY THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE. COMPENSATION IS EXAMINED IN LIGHT OF COMPETITIVE RATES AND ANNUAL PERFORMANCE GOALS. COMPENSATION FOR OTHER OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES IS REVIEWED AND DETERMINED BY EACH SUCH PERSON'S IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR CONSISTENT WITH PAY RANGES AND MARKET CONDITIONS WHICH ARE UPDATED ON A REGULAR BASIS. ALL SUCH EVALUATIONS ARE ALSO REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE REVIEWING SUPERVISOR WHO IS GENERALLY THE PERSON TO WHOM THE REVIEWING SUPERVISOR REPORTS TO. THE COMPENSATION DETERMINATION PROCESS, WHICH INCLUDED REVIEW AND APPROVAL BY INDEPENDENT PERSONS, COMPARABILITY DATA, AND CONTEMPORANEOUS SUBSTANTIATION OF THE DELIBERATION AND DECISION WAS DONE IN THE PREVIOUS YEAR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
FUNDRAISING EVENT EXPENSES 5,623. PRIOR PERIOD ADJUSTMENT -1,046,055. CHANGE IN FAIR VALUE OF INTEREST RATE SWAP -70,741.
THE ORGANIZATION HAS NOT CHANGED THE OVERSIGHT OR SELECTION PROCESS DURING THE TAX YEAR.
